<fragment>
Fitzpatrick earned another AFC Offensive Player of the Week award.[76] In the regular-season finale against the Bills, Fitzpatrick threw for 181 yards, two touchdowns, and three costly interceptions (all in the fourth quarter) as the Jets lost on the road by a score of 22-17 and were eliminated from playoff contention after the Pittsburgh Steelers defeated the Cleveland Browns, despite finishing the year with a 10–6 record.[77]


Having started in all 16 games of the 2015 season, Fitzpatrick finished with 3,905 passing yards, 31 touchdowns, and 15 interceptions, breaking Vinny Testaverde's 1998 franchise record for most touchdown passes in a season. Fitzpatrick also had 60 carries for 270 yards and two touchdowns.[78][79]



#### 2016 season[edit]


![](image)Fitzpatrick in 2016
Fitzpatrick, a free agent after the 2015 season, signed a one-year fully guaranteed $12 million contract with the Jets on July 27, 2016.[80]


</fragment>
<fragment>

Petty was then named the starter for the final four games of the season. Jets head coach Todd Bowles said, "The plan was for us to start him the last four games anyway, so we just started a half early."[92] Petty then started the next three games against the San Francisco 49ers, Miami Dolphins, and New England Patriots.[93] During the Dolphins game, Fitzpatrick relieved Petty due to injury early in the fourth quarter.[94] Petty also suffered an injury in the Patriots game and was replaced by Fitzpatrick in the second quarter.[95] Due to Petty's injury, Fitzpatrick started in the regular season finale, completing 20 of 30 passes for 210 yards and two touchdowns as the Jets beat the Bills by a score of 30–10.[96]


Fitzpatrick finished the 2016 season with 2,710 passing yards, 12 touchdowns, and 17 interceptions to go along with 33 carries for 130 yards in 14 games and 11 starts.[97]


On February 15, 2017, Fitzpatrick's contract was voided, and he became a free agent.[98]



### Tampa Bay Buccaneers[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

<fragment>

During the second quarter of a Week 13 17-10 loss to the Indianapolis Colts, Fitzpatrick scrambled for a two-yard gain, was tripped up, and ended up with a fractured left tibia, ending his season. Fitzpatrick was replaced by rookie Tom Savage, who also received a minor injury.[54] Fitzpatrick finished with 2,483 passing yards, 17 touchdowns, and eight interceptions for a then career-high 95.3 passer rating to go along with 50 carries for 184 yards and two touchdowns and a 6–6 record as the starting quarterback for the Texans.[55]



### New York Jets[edit]


#### 2015 season[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

<fragment>

* Most consecutive regular-season games with at least two touchdown passes in one stadium during a season: 9 (MetLife Stadium, 2015)[168]
* Most career passing touchdowns by an Ivy League graduate: 223[169]
* First quarterback to start a game against one opponent (Jacksonville Jaguars) with six different teams (St. Louis Rams, Buffalo Bills, Houston Texans, New York Jets, Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Miami Dolphins)[170]
* First quarterback to throw four touchdown passes in a single game with six different teams (Buffalo Bills, Tennessee Titans, Houston Texans, New York Jets, Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Miami Dolphins)
* First quarterback to start and win against same opponent (Jacksonville Jaguars) with six different teams[143]
* Most touchdown passes of at least 50 yards through a team's first two games: 4 (tied with Joe Namath)[171]
* Most consecutive games of 400 yards passing and four touchdowns to begin a season: 2 (2018)[172]
* Most consecutive games of 400 yards passing to begin a season: 3 (2018)[173]

</fragment>
<fragment>

Making his first start for the Jets in the season-opening 31-10 victory over the Cleveland Browns, Fitzpatrick threw for 179 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the 31–10 victory.[59] In the next game against the Indianapolis Colts on *Monday Night Football*, he threw for 244 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception as the Jets won on the road by a score of 20–7.[60] The following week against the Philadelphia Eagles, Fitzpatrick threw for 283 yards, two touchdowns, and three interceptions in the 17–24 loss.[61] During a Week 4 27-14 victory over the Miami Dolphins at Wembley Stadium in London, Fitzpatrick threw for 218 yards, a touchdown, and an interception.[62] Two weeks later against the Washington Redskins, Fitzpatrick threw for 253 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception while also rushing for 31 yards and a touchdown in the 34–20 victory.[63] During a Week 7 30-23 road loss to the New England Patriots, Fitzpatrick threw for 295 yards and two touchdowns.[64]


</fragment>
<fragment>

96. **^** Waszak, Dennis Jr. (January 1, 2017). "Fitzpatrick, Powell Lead Jets Past Bumbling Bills 30–10". nbcnewyork.com. Archived from the original on January 2, 2017. Retrieved January 4, 2017.
97. **^** "Ryan Fitzpatrick 2016 Game Log". *Pro-Football-Reference.com*. Archived from the original on November 7, 2017. Retrieved January 4, 2017.

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Ryan Fitzpatrick had a long and varied career in the NFL, playing for multiple teams. Here is a summary of the teams he played for and their head coaches during his tenure:

1. **St. Louis Rams (2005-2006)**
   - Head Coach: Mike Martz (2005), Joe Vitt (2005 interim), Scott Linehan (2006)

2. **Cincinnati Bengals (2007-2008)**
   - Head Coach: Marvin Lewis

3. **Buffalo Bills (2009-2012)**
   - Head Coach: Dick Jauron (2009), Perry Fewell (2009 interim), Chan Gailey (2010-2012)

4. **Tennessee Titans (2013)**
   - Head Coach: Mike Munchak

5. **Houston Texans (2014)**
   - Head Coach: Bill O'Brien

6. **New York Jets (2015-2016)**
   - Head Coach: Todd Bowles

7. **Tampa Bay Buccaneers (2017-2018)**
   - Head Coach: Dirk Koetter

8. **Miami Dolphins (2019-2020)**
   - Head Coach: Brian Flores

9. **Washington Football Team (2021)**
   - Head Coach: Ron Rivera

Fitzpatrick is known for his journeyman career, having played for nine different teams, and he holds several unique records, such as being the first quarterback to start and win against the same opponent (Jacksonville Jaguars) with six different teams.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
